results.name: Denominators in Taylor series for cot x.
reference: M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972, p. 75 (4.3.70).
G. W. Caunt, Infinitesimal Calculus, Oxford Univ. Press, 1914, p. 477.
L. Comtet, Advanced Combinatorics, Reidel, 1974, p. 88.
H. Rademacher, Topics in Analytic Number Theory, Springer, 1973, Chap. 1, p. 19.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = -1..250 (terms -1..100 from T. D. Noe)
M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards, Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972 [alternative scanned copy].
M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972, p. 75 (4.3.70).
formula: coth(x) = W(0)/x -1, W(k) = k+1+2*x-2*x*(k+1)/W(k+1); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Nov 27 2011

coth(x) = Q(0)/(1+x)/x^2 - 1 where Q(k) = 2*k^3 + (2*x+3)*k^2 + (2*x^2+3*x+1)*k + 2*x^3 + 2*x^2 + x - 2*x^2*(k+1)*(2*k+1)*(x+k)*(x+k+2)/Q(k+1); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Feb 28 2013
a(n) = denominator of 4^(n+1)*Zeta(-2*n-1)/(2*n+1)! for n >= 0. - _Peter Luschny_, Jun 20 2013
a(n) = denominator(r(n)), with the negative rational numbers r(n) = [x^n]( (cot(sqrt(x))-1/sqrt(x))/sqrt(x)) for n >= 0. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Oct 07 2016
mathematica: a[n_] := (-1)^(n+1)*4^(n+1)*BernoulliB[2*n+2]/(2*n+2)! // Denominator; Table[a[n], {n, -1, 20}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 14 2014, after _Peter Luschny_ *)
program: print([a(n) for n in range(-1, 20)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 23 2017
(Sage) [denominator( (-1)^(n+1)*4^(n+1)*bernoulli(2*n+2)/factorial(2*n+2) ) for n in (-1..20)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 03 2019
(GAP) List([-1..20], n-> DenominatorRat( (-1)^(n+1)*4^(n+1)* Bernoulli(2*n+2)/Factorial(2*n+2) )) # _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 03 2019
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
